rounds.response:
To respond to White's central pawn break with [d2d4], I will play a move that challenges their central control and develops my pieces. A common response is to play [d7d5] or [g8f6] to develop a piece and prepare to control the center.

I will choose [g8f6] as my response.

[g8f6]

This move develops my knight, prepares to develop other pieces, and puts pressure on the d4 pawn indirectly by preparing to potentially play ...d5 or other moves that challenge White's central control.

Let's see how White responds.
